title: Sareetha v. Venkata Subbaiah (1983)
principle: Restitution of conjugal rights under Section 9 HMA violates woman's right to privacy and dignity under Article 21. Forced cohabitation is unconstitutional.

title: Sarla Mudgal v. Union of India (1995)
principle: Hindu man cannot convert to Islam to contract second marriage while first marriage subsists. Such conversion is fraud and bigamy.

title: Danial Latifi v. Union of India (2001)
principle: Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Divorce) Act 1986 provides for reasonable and fair provision for divorced Muslim women including maintenance.

title: Shayara Bano v. Union of India (2017)
principle: Triple Talaq (instant divorce) declared unconstitutional and violative of Article 14. Muslim women entitled to equal protection under law.

title: Amit Kumar v. Suman Beniwal (2017)
principle: Cruelty under Section 13 HMA includes sustained mental torture, humiliation, and harassment. Single act of cruelty may not suffice unless grave.

title: Rajnesh v. Neha (2020)
principle: Guidelines for maintenance under Section 125 CrPC. Court must consider income, needs, and standard of living. Maintenance should be fair and reasonable.

title: Indra Sarma v. V.K.V. Sarma (2013)
principle: Live-in relationships recognized. Woman in live-in relationship entitled to protection under Domestic Violence Act if relationship is in nature of marriage.

title: Naveen Kohli v. Neelu Kohli (2006)
principle: Irretrievable breakdown of marriage is valid ground for divorce. When marriage is dead beyond repair, court can grant divorce even without statutory ground.

title: Pratibha Rani v. Suraj Kumar (1985)
principle: Custody of child must be decided based on welfare of child. Mother's custody preferred for young children unless she is unfit.

title: Rosy Jacob v. Jacob A. Chakramakkal (1973)
principle: Adultery must be proved by clear and satisfactory evidence. Mere suspicion or opportunity not sufficient. Burden of proof on petitioner.
